title: Analyzing Racial Progress Narratives Through Historical Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of U.S. racial history and structural legal discrimination
context.additional_context: A social studies curriculum centered on critically interpreting the multilayered structure of racial discourse through historical case analysis.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the historical evolution of racial discrimination policies through a four-stage analytical framework, centered on the 1940s Méndez case.
Learners can argue the historical limitations and societal impacts of legal victories by applying an anti-essentialist perspective.
Learners can produce analytical reports critically deconstructing simplified progressive narratives in historical discourse.

resources: Access to digital historical document archive
Online collaboration tools (Padlet, Google Docs, etc.)
Database of relevant court rulings and news articles

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
